alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 5:46AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOW FOR THE ALASKA RANGE PASSES... A weather front will move into the Alaska Range today bringing 6 to 12 inches of snow to the passes by Wednesday afternoon. Along the Parks Highway, south of Anderson, 4 to 8 inches of snow is expected over the next 48 hours, while along the Richardson Highway south of Salcha to Trims Camp and on the Tok Cutoff expect 5 to 10 inches of snow. Winds will generally be light and variable, but some drifting and blowing snow can be expected locally. Residents should use caution traveling through these areas, and be prepared for difficult travel conditions. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
